Major issues
* Most items stack to 64, but not everything. Your original statement is misleading.
* The statement addresses the reader directly. The contribution guidelines advise against this style.
* The statement is unformatted. Please study the formatting syntax on this page: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement .
* There are several typos and signs of careless writing that reduce clarity.
* Examples shouldn't appear in the Goal section unless explanation is included.
* No constraints are specified.

Please rewrite the various sections as follows:

Goal
In Minecraft, most items stack in groups of 64.

Given the total number of items [[N]], represent it as a sequence of stacks on a single line. Each full stack contains 64 items, and any remainder forms a final stack on the right.

Stacks are separated by the character {{|}}, and the output must begin and end with a {{|}} too.

Input
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for the total number of items.

Output
<<Line 1>>: The stacked representation of [[N]].

Constraints
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 2^14

Stub generator
* Please remove Line 5. The purpose of a "write" statement is not to include the author's (your) information.

Cases
* The name for Validator 2 is missing.

* Test 2 and Validator 2 currently use identical inputs; they should differ.

* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs, except for edge cases. Please revise the cases as follows:

  • Test 1 and Validator 1: Edge case, both use 64

  • Test 2 and Validator 2: Small multiples of 64 (e.g. 128 and 192)

  • Test 3 and Validator 3: Small values greater than 64 but not multiples of 64

  • Test 4 and Validator 4: Value smaller than 64

  • Test 5 and Validator 5: Bigger multiples of 64

  • Test 6 and Validator 6: Bigger values which aren't multiples of 64

Thanks.

Thanks for the revision. The statement is clearer overall, but a few issues still need attention:

Goal
* The structure line
  "--- |64|64|64(for full stacks)...|(uncompleted piece if it is nonzero)|"
  
  is unclear. It mixes explanation with the example, and the leading "---" may make one think it's part of the output format. The output format is also underspecified.

* Please provide a clear explanation of the rules first, and only then show the general structure.

* That is, remove the following section:

"here is the structure:
--- |64|64|64(for full stacks)...|(uncompleted piece if it is nonzero)|"

* And remove all examples (N = 120, 128, 511).

* After that, add the following clarification at the end:

• The stacks are displayed on a single line. 

• Each full stack contains 64 items, and any non-zero remainder forms a final stack on the right.

• Stacks are separated by {{|}}, and the output must begin and end with {{|}}.

The general structure is:
{{|64|64|64}}…{{|}}[[remainder]]{{|}}

Input
* Please format [[N]] as a variable.

* Please provide a description of what N represents (see the example wording in my previous comment).

Cases
* Many stacks (Test 3): Please choose another value of N so that the final stack is between 1 and 9, similar to Validator 3.

* Please add a new pair of cases where N = 64 (edge case).

* Please add a new pair of cases where N is a bigger multiple of 64.

Thanks.
